intro: Glomeraria alba, commonly known as the white glomeraria, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, spicy scent when crushed. Glomeraria alba is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
